page.title: 13Dunn Village Hall,Warbleton
page.content: Money to build a village hall was originally donated by Mr F.G.Dunn in l91O but it was not built until l934 on land donated by the Darbys. The hall is used frequently. The Warbleton & Buxted band rehearse twice a week & the country & western band once a week. Other weekly users include the doctor and the library service. A chiropodist holds a clinic fortnightly whilst two different Womens Institutes hold monthly meetings as does the Local History Group. The hall is used occasionally for A.G.M.s, P.C.C. meetings, elections, jumble sales, coffee mornings, children's parties, wedding receptions, dinner & dances, concerts, art exhibitions etc. Hire charges for regular users are Â£2.7O an hour. Occasional users pay Â£4.25 an hour whilst a jumble sale requires Â£l6.OO and an election Â£5O.OO.
